citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Charlie (#201), an adult male Irish Setter, had fur matting and a moist, black discharge in and around his left ear. The
licensee stated that they had been out of town until the day prior and they had not noticed it since returning and their
caretaker had not mentioned it. Discharge from the ear can indicate an ear infection and be painful. Daily observation of
all animals must be done to assess their health and well-being so that health concerns can be communicated to the
veterinarian in a timely manner. Correct by observing all animals daily, communicating any concerns to the veterinarian,
and providing prompt treatment when warranted from 5/1//24 forward.

The attending veterinarian has not visited the premises and performed a hands-on exam of every dog since 2/23/23. The
program of vet care states that visits will occur annually and hands-on exams will occur at the annual visit. The licensee
had records from visits from the last 2-3 years but admitted that the vet had not been out this year. Regularly scheduled
visits to the premise and complete physical exams every 12 months are crucial to assessing the adequacy of vet care and
animal health. Correct by scheduling a site visit by the attending veterinarian with hands-on exams of all adults dogs by
5/31/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Charlie (#201), an adult male Irish Setter, had fur matting and a moist, black discharge in and around his left ear. The 
licensee stated that they had been out of town until the day prior and they had not noticed it since returning and their 
caretaker had not mentioned it. Discharge from the ear can indicate an ear infection and be painful. Daily observation of 
all animals must be done to assess their health and well-being so that health concerns can be communicated to the 
veterinarian in a timely manner. Correct by observing all animals daily, communicating any concerns to the veterinarian, 
and providing prompt treatment when warranted from 5/1//24 forward. 
3.13(a)(1) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The attending veterinarian has not visited the premises and performed a hands-on exam of every dog since 2/23/23. The 
program of vet care states that visits will occur annually and hands-on exams will occur at the annual visit. The licensee 
had records from visits from the last 2-3 years but admitted that the vet had not been out this year. Regularly scheduled 
visits to the premise and complete physical exams every 12 months are crucial to assessing the adequacy of vet care and 
animal health. Correct by scheduling a site visit by the attending veterinarian with hands-on exams of all adults dogs by 
5/31/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
